byline.contributor: Susanne Craig reported from Plattsburgh, and Benjamin Mueller and William K. Rashbaum from New York. Reporting was contributed by Michael Schwirtz, Michael Winerip and Vivian Yee from New York, and Thomas Kaplan from Albany.
byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG, WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and BENJAMIN MUELLER

abstract: Gene Palmer, Clinton Correctional Facility corrections officer, admits to investigators he smuggled screwdriver and pliers into prison for Richard W Matt, one of escaped killers, in return for dozen paintings and other drawings by him; his arrest indicates escape was aided by several prison workers.
lead_paragraph: Gene Palmer, an officer at Clinton Correctional Facility, described giving Richard Matt a screwdriver and pliers in exchange for a dozen elaborate paintings by the inmate.

headline.main: New York Prison Escapee Traded Art for Favors From a Guard
headline.print_headline: Escapee Traded Art for Favors From a Guard

snippet: Gene Palmer, an officer at Clinton Correctional Facility, described giving Richard Matt a screwdriver and pliers in exchange for a dozen elaborate paintings by the inmate.
